aa9414e4e182442797999e87e1efebb8,SPE4AX-23-R-USNE,Sustainment Engineering and Improvement support of United States Navy CFM56-7B27 engines operated on the P-8A aircraft,"This notice services as DLA Aviation’s combined synopsis/solicitation as described in FAR 12.603, in accordance with FAR 5.201 and the approved J&A as well as Amendments 1 and 2, for addition of sustainment engineering services and improvement for United States Navy CFM56-7B27 engines operated on the P-8A aircraft.  Addition to sole source Long Term Contract SPE4AX-17-D-9403 to CFM International Inc. (CFM), Contractor and Government Entity (CAGE) code 58828.
This is a FAR part 12 effort being added to the current contract SPE4AX-17-D-9403.

Engine sustainment engineering and improvement for the United States Navy (USN) are being solicited to be added to contract SPE4AX-17-D-9403, awarded to CFM International Inc. Cage 58828. Actual requirements for the additional scope will be negotiated and added to the basic contract. Individual requirements are certified as sole source to CFM and synopsized in accordance with FAR 5.201.

DLA Aviation will issue a letter solicitation (RFP) to the sole source Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM). If any non-OEM source is interested in any of the NSNs, please notify the Contracting Officer prior to the combined synopsis/solicitation closing date. A copy of the letter of interest should be forwarded to the Contracting Officer identified herein. The Government may alter the acquisition strategy if it is in the best interest of the Government. In order to receive an award, you must be registered in the System for Award Management (SAM). SAM registration is at https://www.sam.gov.

The proposed contract action is to add sustainment engineering services and improvement for United States Navy CFM56-7B27 engines operated on the P-8A aircraft.  It is anticipated that this requirement will be added as a separate line item to the current sole source CFM COI contract SPE4AX-17-D-9403.  The engine data required to perform the necessary sustainment engineering services and improvement is CFM’s proprietary and confidential commercial intellectual data and cannot be shared or provided by the Government.  Only sources with access to the CFM56-7B27 series of engines performance information will be considered as a qualified source.
The scope of work includes:

column2: Program Management, which includes EPD Planning and Development, preparation of related documentation, program status reviews/reporting, and control of program expenditures

Sustainment Engineering, which includes, investigation of issues, conducting testing and analyses, and attempting to develop engineering solutions or other corrective actions to resolve problems experienced by the NAWCAD ASG CFM56-7B27 engine fleet.

Repair Engineering, which includes, developing/updating, demonstrating, and providing repair engineering support for repair/rework and/or inspection procedures for candidate parts agreed to with NAVAIR.
Contractor would provide reviews to discuss performance, trends, and issues on a mutually agreed to basis.

49ead69b3a0a4368a9565dd5ca50b765,N00019-23-RFPREQ-APM290-0216PS,CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases and Stage 4 – Stage 9 PVD Erosion Coated HPC Blades,The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR), Patuxent River, MD intends to award a commercial item contract to CFM International (CFM), located in Ohio, on an other than full and open competition basis, for the procurement of approximately two (2) new production CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator High Pressure Compressor (HPC) Cases (P/N: 1559M30G15) and approximately eleven (11) sets of new production Stage 4 – Stage 9 PVD Erosion Coated HPC Blades (P/Ns: P394P09, P394P10, P394P11, P394P12, P395P09, P395P10, P395P11, P395P12, P396P09, P396P10, P396P11, P396P12, P397P09, P397P10, P397P11, P397P12, P398P09, P398P10, P398P11, P398P12, P399P09, P399P10, P399P11, P399P12). The planned award date is May 2023 and all deliveries are to be completed within 1 year of award.

The effort shall be procured pursuant to 10 U.S.C. 2304 (c)(1) and FAR 6.302-1, “Only One Responsible Source and No Other Type of Supplies or Services will Satisfy Agency Requirements.”  CFM is the only source with the requisite knowledge, experience, technical expertise, and technical data necessary to furnish the contemplated supplies and services in a timely manner.

This Sources Sought Notice is issued in accordance with DFARS 206.302-1(d) and PGI 206.302-1.  This is not a Request for Proposals. The Government does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this Notice or otherwise pay any person’s costs incurred responding to this Notice.
BACKGROUND:

The CFM56-7B27AE is the only engine certified for the P-8A and new production CFM56-7B27AE parts are required to maintain configuration consistency with the engines and aircraft that have been delivered.  Currently, the Government does not possess or have unlimited rights to all the necessary data developed by the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) for the CFM56-7B27AE engines to certify any hardware that is not new production CFM56-7B27AE parts.

Capability Statements received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement.  Capability Statements submitted should be pertinent and specific in the technical/management/business area under consideration, on each of the following qualifications.

(1) Execution:  A description of the approach for obtaining and delivering the new production CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated High Pressure Compressor Stator Cases and Stage 4 – Stage 9 PVD Erosion Coated HPC Blades. Due to the fact that CFM International (CFM) is the OEM for the CFM56-7B27AE engines, each HPC Stator Case and HPC Blades must be from a CFM approved source.

6bce516158c84f14ab867695aca45e52,N00019-24-RFPREQ-APM290-0017PS,P-8A and C-40 QECs/EBUs and Mating QECs/EBUs to CFM56 Core Engines,"DISCLAIMER

THIS NOTICE IS FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.  THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL.  IT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A COMMITMENT BY THE GOVERNMENT.  RESPONSES IN ANY FORM ARE NOT OFFERS AND THE GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO AWARD A CONTRACT AS A RESULT OF THIS NOTICE.  NO FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO PAY FOR PREPARATION OF RESPONSES TO THIS NOTICE.  ANY INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY RESPONDENTS TO THIS NOTICE IS STRICTLY VOLUNTARY.
INTRODUCTION

The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) intends to issue a solicitation, negotiate and award an Indefinite Delivery/ Indefinite Quantity contract to Aviall Services Inc. (Aviall), located in Texas, on an other than full and open competition basis, for the procurement of new Quick Engine Change/Engine Build Up components (QECs/EBUs) and the mating of those QECs/EBUs to CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines for P-8A Poseidon and C-40 Clipper aircraft, respectively.
Planned ordering quantities are:
-Annual Minimums:  1 QEC/EBU and the mating of that QEC/EBU to 1 core engine
-Annual Maximums:  Approximately 7 QECs/EBUs and the mating of the QECs/EBUs to 7 P-8A engines; and 1 QEC/EBU and the mating of that QEC/EBU to 1 C-40 core engine
-Grand Total:  Approximately 32 QECs/EBUs and the mating of the QECs/EBUs to 32 P-8A engines; and 2 QECs/EBUs and the mating of the QECs/EBUs to 2 C-40 core engines
Order delivery requirements are:
-Each QEC/EBU is new
-Each delivery unit includes 1 QEC/EBU mated to a Government-furnished core engine
-First delivery unit to be delivered at or before 16 months after order placement
-Subsequent delivery units:  1 per month
Initial contract award is planned to occur during either fourth quarter of Government Fiscal Year (FY) 2023 or first quarter of FY 2024.
ELIGIBILITY
The Product Service Code (PSC) for this requirement is 2840 and the NAICS code is 336412.
PROGRAM BACKGROUND

Each QEC/EBU provides all the hardware needed to attach and integrate the aircraft engine onto the aircraft.  Aviall, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Boeing Company is the QEC/EBU Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).  As the OEM, Aviall is the only company that possesses the complete set of technical data for manufacturing QECs/EBUs and mating those QECs/EBUs to CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines for P-8A Poseidon and C-40 Clipper aircraft.
REQUIRED CAPABILITIES

For each of the five ordering periods planned to begin during either fourth quarter of Government FY 2023 or the first quarter of FY 2024, the contractor shall manufacture new QECs/EBUs and mate those QECs/EBUs to Government-furnished CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines in accordance with the above described Order delivery requirements and for each order that falls within the above described Planned ordering quantities.  Since the Government does not possess sufficient technical data that a contractor would require in order for that contractor to fulfill these planned requirements, any contractor (other than Aviall) must either team/partner with Aviall or obtain a license from Aviall for the technical data.  The contractor shall provide the facilities, equipment, material, technical data, and qualified personnel to accomplish the manufacture of new QECs/EBUs and the mating of those QECs/EBUs to Government-furnished CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines.

In addition to the requirements above, please note that under a Small Business Set-Aside, the small business prime must perform at least 50% of the work itself in terms of cost of performance.  Cost of performance includes direct labor costs, overhead that has only direct labor as its base, and the small business’ General & Administrative rate multiplied by the labor cost.  The small business prime cannot utilize the cost performance of other small businesses it utilizes as subcontractors in calculating its performance to comply with FAR Clause 52.219-14.  If the prime is a joint venture, the cost of performance by both small business concerns is utilized in calculating its performance to comply with FAR 52.219-14.
SUBMISSION DETAILS
Interested persons (respondents), other than Aviall, must submit an UNCLASSIFIED capability statement.
Each capability statement shall include/address at a minimum:

(1) Small/Large Business Status:  A company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office location(s), DUNS Number, CAGE Code, and a statement regarding current small/large business status. 85f09ff611c547109d8a94d45426dd6b,N00019-22-RFPREQ-APM290-0033PS,P-8A and C-40 New CFM56 Core Engines,"DISCLAIMER

THIS NOTICE IS FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.  THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL.  IT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A COMMITMENT BY THE GOVERNMENT.  RESPONSES IN ANY FORM ARE NOT OFFERS AND THE GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO AWARD A CONTRACT AS A RESULT OF THIS NOTICE.  NO FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO PAY FOR PREPARATION OF RESPONSES TO THIS NOTICE.  ANY INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY RESPONDENTS TO THIS NOTICE IS STRICTLY VOLUNTARY.
INTRODUCTION

The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) intends to issue a solicitation, negotiate and award an Indefinite Delivery/ Indefinite Quantity contract to CFM International (CFM), located in Ohio, on an other than full and open competition basis, for the procurement of new CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines for P-8A Poseidon and C-40 Clipper aircraft, respectively.
Planned ordering quantities are:
-Annual Minimums:  1 engine
-Annual Maximums:  Approximately 7 P-8A engines and 1 C-40 engine
-Grand Total:  Approximately 32 P-8A engines and 2 C-40 engines
Order delivery requirements are:
-Each engine is new, meaning that it has no operational time except for engine test cell operation
-Each delivery includes engine, cover, stand and cradle
-First engine to be delivered at or before 11 months after order placement
-subsequent engines:  1 engine per month
Initial contract award is planned to occur during either fourth quarter of Government Fiscal Year (FY) 2023 or first quarter of FY 2024.
ELIGIBILITY
The Product Service Code (PSC) for this requirement is 2840 and the NAICS code is 336412.
PROGRAM BACKGROUND

CFM International (CFM), Cincinnati, OH is the original equipment manufacturer (OEM).  The CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E engines meet all requirements set forth by the NAVAIR Airworthiness Authority and are essential for maintaining configuration consistency throughout the P-8 and C-40 aircraft fleets.  As the OEM, CFM is the only company that possesses the complete set of technical data for those engines.
REQUIRED CAPABILITIES

For each of the five ordering periods planned to begin during either fourth quarter of Government FY 2023 or the first quarter of FY 2024, the contractor shall manufacture and deliver new core engines in accordance with the above described Order delivery requirements and for each order that falls within the above described Planned ordering quantities.  Since the Government does not possess sufficient technical data that a contractor would require in order for that contractor to fulfill these planned requirements, any contractor (other than CFM) must either team/partner with CFM or obtain a license from CFM for the technical data.  The contractor shall provide the facilities, equipment, material, technical data, and qualified personnel to accomplish the manufacture and delivery of the core engines.

In addition to the requirements above, please note that under a Small Business Set-Aside, the small business prime must perform at least 50% of the work itself in terms of cost of performance.  Cost of performance includes direct labor costs, overhead that has only direct labor as its base, and the small business’ General & Administrative rate multiplied by the labor cost.  The small business prime cannot utilize the cost performance of other small businesses it utilizes as subcontractors in calculating its performance to comply with FAR Clause 52.219-14.  If the prime is a joint venture, the cost of performance by both small business concerns is utilized in calculating its performance to comply with FAR 52.219-14.
SUBMISSION DETAILS
Interested persons (respondents), other than CFM, must submit an UNCLASSIFIED capability statement.
Each capability statement shall include/address at a minimum:

(1) Small/Large Business Status:  A company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office location(s), DUNS Number, CAGE Code, and a statement regarding current small/large business status.  Respondents to this notice must indicate whether they qualify as a Small, Small Disadvantaged, Small Disadvantaged Veteran Owned Small Business, Women-Owned, 8(a), Hub Zone or Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business Concern.  If claiming small business status, provide an explanation of your company's ability to perform at least 50% of the work itself in terms of cost of performance.

(2) Business:  Due to the fact that CFM is the only entity with sufficient technical data that a contractor would require in order for that contractor to fulfill these planned requirements, each interested party (other than CFM) must include either (1) a teaming agreement (or equivalent document) signed by CFM indicating agreement to partner with or be a subcontractor to the interested party for the contemplated procurement; or (2) a document signed by CFM indicating agreement to offer a license to the interested party for the technical data.
(3) Execution:  A description of the technical approach for commencing the effort at the estimated award date of either fourth quarter of Government FY 2023 or the first quarter of FY 2024.
(4) Experience:  A description of previous (awarded within last 3 years) or current relevant contracts.
(5) Facilities and Equipment:  Availability and description of facilities and equipment that will be utilized to meet requirements.
(6) Any other specific and pertinent information as pertains to this particular area of procurement that would enhance our consideration and evaluation of the Capability Statement.

Data Markings.  In order to complete its review, NAVAIR must be able to share a respondent’s information both within the Government and with covered Government support contractors as defined in DFARS clause 252.227-7013 Rights in Technical Data—Noncommercial Items (FEB 2014).  Any responses marked in a manner that will not permit such review may be returned without being assessed or considered.  All submissions must include a statement which clearly allows for the information to be disclosed with covered Government support contractors.

The Government requests that respondents deliver responses electronically via e-mail in Microsoft Word or PDF format with proper data markings for unclassified and proprietary information not later than the Response Date indicated on this Notice.  Classified material SHALL NOT be submitted.  All submissions should include this Presolicitation Notice Reference Number, company name, company address, CAGE code, DUNS number, and a point-of-contact who is able to discuss the Capability Statement submitted.  Point-of-contact information should include name, position, phone number, and email address.  Responses that fail to comply with the above instructions or present ideas not pertinent to subject, may not be reviewed.  Information submitted in response to this Notice is submitted at no cost to the Government and will not be returned.  The Government is under no obligation to provide responses or comments to information received from interested persons, but may request additional information following review.

4f02638d6fe0421d83546b65867b37bd,N00019-24-RFPREQ-APM290-0017SS,P-8A and C-40 QECs/EBUs and Mating QECs/EBUs to CFM56 Core Engines,"This market research tool is being used to identify potential and eligible firms, of all sizes, prior to determining the method of acquisition and issuance of a solicitation.
DISCLAIMER

THIS NOTICE IS FOR INFORMATIONAL PURPOSES ONLY.  THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL.  IT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A COMMITMENT BY THE GOVERNMENT.  RESPONSES IN ANY FORM ARE NOT OFFERS AND THE GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO AWARD A CONTRACT AS A RESULT OF THIS NOTICE.  NO FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO PAY FOR PREPARATION OF RESPONSES TO THIS NOTICE.  ANY INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY RESPONDENTS TO THIS NOTICE IS STRICTLY VOLUNTARY.
INTRODUCTION

The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) is seeking sources as it intends to procure new Quick Engine Change/Engine Build Up components (QECs/EBUs) and the mating of those QECs/EBUs to CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines for P-8A Poseidon and C-40 Clipper aircraft, respectively.  The establishment of a FAR Part 12 Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) contract with a 5-year ordering period is envisioned.
Planned ordering quantities are:
-Annual Minimums:  1 QEC/EBU and the mating of that QEC/EBU to 1 core engine
-Annual Maximums:  Approximately 7 QECs/EBUs and the mating of the QECs/EBUs to 7 P-8A engines; and 1 QEC/EBU and the mating of that QEC/EBU to 1 C-40 core engine
-Grand Total:  Approximately 32 QECs/EBUs and the mating of the QECs/EBUs to 32 P-8A engines; and 2 QECs/EBUs and the mating of the QECs/EBUs to 2 C-40 core engines
Order delivery requirements are:
-Each QEC/EBU is new
-Each delivery unit includes 1 QEC/EBU mated to a Government-furnished core engine
-First delivery unit to be delivered at or before 16 months after order placement
-subsequent delivery units:  1 per month
Initial contract award is planned to occur during either fourth quarter of Government Fiscal Year (FY) 2023 or first quarter of FY 2024.  This announcement constitutes a sources sought synopsis.

THIS NOTICE IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL.  It is a market research tool being used to determine potential and eligible businesses capable of providing the supplies described herein prior to determining the method of acquisition and issuance of a Request for Proposal.  The Government is not obligated to and will not pay for any information received from potential sources as a result of this Notice.
ELIGIBILITY
The Product Service Code (PSC) for this requirement is 2840 and the NAICS code is 336412.
PROGRAM BACKGROUND

Each QEC/EBU provides all the hardware needed to attach and integrate the aircraft engine onto the aircraft.  Aviall Services, Inc. (Aviall), Dallas, TX, a wholly owned subsidiary of The Boeing Company is the QEC/EBU Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM).  As the OEM, Aviall is the only company that possesses the complete set of technical data for manufacturing QECs/EBUs and mating those QECs/EBUs to CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines for P-8A Poseidon and C-40 Clipper aircraft.
REQUIRED CAPABILITIES

For each of the five ordering periods planned to begin during either fourth quarter of Government FY 2023 or the first quarter of FY 2024, the contractor shall manufacture new QECs/EBUs and mate those QECs/EBUs to Government-furnished CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines in accordance with the above described Order delivery requirements and for each order that falls within the above described Planned ordering quantities.  Since the Government does not possess sufficient technical data that a contractor would require in order for that contractor to fulfill these planned requirements, any contractor (other than Aviall) must either team/partner with Aviall or obtain a license from Aviall for the technical data.  The contractor shall provide the facilities, equipment, material, technical data, and qualified personnel to accomplish the manufacture of new QECs/EBUs and the mating of those QECs/EBUs to Government-furnished CFM56-7B27AE and CFM56-7B24E core engines.

In addition to the requirements above, please note that under a Small Business Set-Aside, the small business prime must perform at least 50% of the work itself in terms of cost of performance.  Cost of performance includes direct labor costs, overhead that has only direct labor as its base, and the small business’ General & Administrative rate multiplied by the labor cost.  The small business prime cannot utilize the cost performance of other small businesses it utilizes as subcontractors in calculating its performance to comply with FAR Clause 52.219-14.  If the prime is a joint venture, the cost of performance by both small business concerns is utilized in calculating its performance to comply with FAR 52.219-14.
SUBMISSION DETAILS
Interested persons (respondents), other than Aviall, must submit an UNCLASSIFIED capability statement.
Each capability statement shall include/address at a minimum:

(1) Small/Large Business Status:  A company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office location(s), DUNS Number, CAGE Code, and a statement regarding current small/large business status.  Respondents to this notice must indicate whether they qualify as a Small, Small Disadvantaged, Small Disadvantaged Veteran Owned Small Business, Women-Owned, 8(a), Hub Zone or Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business Concern.  If claiming small business status, provide an explanation of your company's ability to perform at least 50% of the work itself in terms of cost of performance.

(2) Business:  Due to the fact that Aviall is the only entity with sufficient technical data that a contractor would require in order for that contractor to fulfill these planned requirements, each interested party (other than AVIALL) must include either (1) a teaming agreement (or equivalent document) signed by AVIALL indicating agreement to partner with or be a subcontractor to the interested party for the contemplated procurement; or (2) a document signed by AVIALL indicating agreement to offer a license to the interested party for the technical data.
(3) Execution:  A description of the technical approach for commencing the effort at the estimated award date of either fourth quarter of Government FY 2023 or the first quarter of FY 2024.
(4) Experience:  A description of previous (awarded within last 3 years) or current relevant contracts.
(5) Facilities and Equipment:  Availability and description of facilities and equipment that will be utilized to meet requirements.
(6) Any other specific and pertinent information as pertains to this particular area of procurement that would enhance our consideration and evaluation of the Capability Statement.

Data Markings.  In order to complete its review, NAVAIR must be able to share a respondent’s information both within the Government and with covered Government support contractors as defined in DFARS clause 252.227-7013 Rights in Technical Data—Noncommercial Items (FEB 2014).  Any responses marked in a manner that will not permit such review may be returned without being assessed or considered.  All submissions must include a statement which clearly allows for the information to be disclosed with covered Government support contractors.

Point-of-contact information should include name, position, phone number, and email address.  Responses that fail to comply with the above instructions or present ideas not pertinent to subject, may not be reviewed.  Information submitted in response to this Notice is submitted at no cost to the Government and will not be returned. ca0259f34396404aa0a2e1be0dd19603,N00019-22-RFPREQ-APM290-0060PN,P-8A Poseidon Engine Depot Maintenance and Repair IDIQ MACs,"This Notice is related to the P-8A Poseidon Engine Depot Maintenance and Repair IDIQ MACs Sources Sought Notice posted on 15 March 2022. NAVAIR did not receive any capability statements from Small Businesses in response to the 15 March 2022 Sources Sought Notice. The purpose of this Notice is to announce NAVAIR’s initial determination of pursuing a full and open competition.  Its additional purpose is to provide one more opportunity for interested parties, especially Small Businesses, that did not respond to the 15 March 2022 Sources Sought Notice to submit capability statements in response to this Presolicitation Notice.  NAVAIR intends to make a final determination of either pursuing a full and open competition or pursuing a small business set-aside based on NAVAIR’s assessment of all capability statements received in response to the Sources Sought Notice and this Presolicitation Notice.
INTRODUCTION

The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR), on behalf of PMA-290 (Maritime, Patrol, and Reconnaissance Aircraft), announces its intention to procure, on a competitive basis, depot level maintenance services for P-8A Poseidon aircraft CFM56-7B27 A/3 series and CFM56-7B27AE series engines.  NAVAIR intends to award up to two FAR Part 12 Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) Multiple Award Contracts (MACs) with five one-year ordering periods.  Planned award date is during either fourth quarter of Government Fiscal Year (FY) 2024 or first quarter of Government FY 2025.  The services are currently being performed by The Boeing Company (Boeing) of Seattle, Washington under IDIQ MAC N0001918D0113 and Standard Aero Inc. of San Antonio, TX under IDIQ MAC N0001918D0110.  Each of the existing contracts includes firm fixed price (FFP) and time-and-materials (T&M) contract line item numbers (CLINs).  The final ordering period of each contract ends after 15 October 2024.

THIS NOTICE IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL.  It is a market research tool being used to determine potential and eligible large and small businesses, other than Boeing and Standard Aero, capable of providing the services described herein prior to determining the method of acquisition and issuance of a Request for Proposal.  The information received will also be utilized by the Government in developing its acquisition/contracting strategy and Statement of Work/Performance Work Statement.  The Government is not obligated to and will not pay for any information received from potential sources as a result of this synopsis.
ELIGIBILITY

The PSC for this requirement is J028; the NAICS is 488190 with a small business size standard of $35.0 million. All interested businesses are encouraged to respond.  Specifically, the Government is evaluating the possibility of establishing this requirement as a Small Business Set-Aside.
PROGRAM BACKGROUND

Two CFM56-7B27A/3 series engines power each P-8A Poseidon test aircraft and two CFM56-7B27AE series engines power each fleet aircraft.  CFM is the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) of these engines.  Each Ready for Issue (RFI) engine includes not only a core engine (CFM56-7B27 A/3 series or CFM56-7B27AE series) but also an Engine Buildup Unit (EBU).  Boeing is the OEM of the EBU.  The first P-8A test aircraft was delivered to the Government in October 2009.  P-8A aircraft, including the engines, continue to be produced for the U.S. and various foreign countries.  As previously stated, P-8A aircraft engines are currently receiving depot level maintenance and repair via orders issued under the ongoing IDIQ MACs which were awarded in February 2018.
ANTICIPATED PERIOD OF PERFORMANCE

As previously stated, NAVAIR intends to award up to two IDIQ MACs in either fourth quarter Government FY 2024 or first quarter Government FY 2025.  Each IDIQ MAC is planned to include five one-year ordering periods.
ANTICIPATED CONTRACT TYPE
Each IDIQ MAC is planned to be a FAR Part 12 Commercial Item contract which includes FFP and T&M CLINs.
REQUIREMENTS

It is anticipated that each IDIQ MAC will enable NAVAIR to procure on behalf of the United States, Australia, and other FMS countries, scheduled and unscheduled depot-level maintenance and repair of CFM56-7B27A/3 and CFM56-7B27AE engines, primarily at the contractor’s facilities, but also, in rare cases, either within or outside of the Continental United States at field activities’ main operating bases or at deployed locations.  Except for a limited amount of P-8A unique Government Furnished Equipment, each contractor shall furnish all facilities, labor, services, equipment, tools, parts, materials, and consumables to fulfill requirements.  Each contractor shall maintain an up-to-date technical library.  Each contractor shall be a Title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 145 certified repair station and a CFM-certified engine Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul (MRO) provider.

In addition to the requirements above, please note that under a Small Business Set-Aside, the small business prime must perform at least 50% of the work themselves in terms of cost of performance.  Cost of performance includes direct labor costs, overhead that has only direct labor as its base, and the small business’ General & Administrative rate multiplied by the labor cost.  The small business prime cannot utilize the cost performance of other small businesses it utilizes as subcontractors in calculating its performance to comply with FAR Clause 52.219-14.  If the prime is a joint venture, the cost of performance by both small business concerns is utilized in calculating its performance to comply with FAR 52.219-14.
SUBMITTAL INFORMATION

It is requested that each interested party (respondent), other than incumbents Boeing and Standard Aero and each party that submitted a capability statement in response to the 15 March 2022 Sources Sought Notice, submit a Capability Statement package demonstrating the respondent’s ability to fulfill the above-described requirements based on responses to the below listed items:
1.   Describe your company’s approach for scheduled and unscheduled aircraft engine depot level maintenance and repair.
2.   The Navy’s current strategy is to award up to two IDIQ MACs for the engine repair requirements.  This will result in the two awardees competing for work on an annual basis.
a.   Describe any impacts related to proposing to an IDIQ MAC.
b.   Is there a minimum number of annual inductions required to interest your company in this procurement and if so, what is the minimum number of annual inductions?
3.   Provide evidence that your company is a Title 14, Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 145 certified repair station.
4.   Provide evidence that your company is a CFM-certified engine Maintenance, Repair, and Overhaul (MRO) provider.
a.   Include a description of your company’s approach to obtaining the most current Engine Shop Manuals.
b.   Include a description of your company’s approach to obtaining engineering reach back to CFM.
5.   Describe your company’s commercial quality control and assurance processes.
6.   Describe your company’s approach to managing Critical Safety Item/Critical Application Item requirements.
7.   Describe the percentage of the CFM56-7B27A/3 and CFM56-7B27AE engine repair work your company performs in house and the percentage that is subcontracted/outsourced.
8.   Describe the lead time your company requires for the first engine induction following contract award.
9.   Describe your company’s engine induction process and average/typical turnaround times.
10. Describe your company's Over and Above (O&A) approach/process during various Repair, Restoration, and Overhaul scenarios.
11. The P-8A engines will not be utilizing parts from a commercial spare parts pool.  Describe how your company will manage P-8A specific engine parts.
12. Describe your company's processes for segregating Government hardware/material to ensure it does not mix with other customer assets.
13. Describe your company’s processes for preventing counterfeit parts from being installed into Navy engines.
14. Describe your company’s process for managing life limited parts/long-lead life limited parts.
15. Does your company maintain insurance that covers military engines?
16. Describe your standard warranty(ies) (e.g., what is warranted and for how long).
17. Confirm your company’s ability to provide examples of an FAA approved repair substantiation data package and used part/component maintenance history/service records.
18. Describe your company’s ability to provide engine Field Assessment and Repair coverage (e.g., field assessment and repair at a field activity location or at a deployed location).
19. Describe your company’s maximum engine throughput per year and ability to meet potential surge requirements beyond the maximum throughput.
20. For reference:

a.   This effort requires vendors to have licenses in place with The Boeing Company for Boeing specific technical data prior to contract award.  Boeing technical data may be required to maintain/repair the EBU or to incorporate Boeing service bulletins related to the EBU.
b.   This effort requires vendors to enter Engine Transaction Reports (ETR) into the Navy’s DECKPLATE database system.
21. If you are a small business, provide an explanation of your company’s ability to perform at least 50% of the tasking described in this SOW for the base period as well as the option periods.
22. Provide a statement including current small/large business status and company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office locations, CAGE code, DUNS number, etc.

23. Respondents to this notice must also indicate whether they are a large business or qualify as a Small, Small Disadvantaged, Small Disadvantaged Veteran Owned Small Business, Women-Owned, 8(a), Hub Zone or Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business Concern.
24. Please add other information your company believes is relevant to aid the Government in refining its acquisition strategy.

Only Capability Statements received not later than the Response Date indicated in this Notice will be considered by the Government.  Interested parties are advised against submitting a Capability Statement that merely mimics information in this Notice, provides brochure-like information, or provides general information.  Each Capability Statement package shall be no more than 30 single-spaced, 8.5 x 11 inch pages using 12 point Times New Roman font minimum.  The Government requests that respondents deliver Capability Statements electronically via e-mail in Microsoft Word or PDF format with proper data markings for unclassified and proprietary information.  Classified material SHALL NOT be submitted.  All submissions should include this Notice Reference Number, Company name, Company address, CAGE code, DUNS number, and point of contact information (name, position, phone number and email address).  In order to complete its review, NAVAIR must be able to share a respondent’s Capability Statement both within the Government and with covered Government support contractors as defined in DFARS clause 252.227-7015 Technical Data--Commercial Items (FEB 2014).  Any capability statements marked in a manner that will not permit such review may be returned without being assessed or considered.  All submissions must include a statement which clearly allows for the information to be disclosed with covered Government support contractors.  Information submitted in response to this notice is submitted at no cost to the Government and will not be returned.  The Government is under no obligation to provide responses or comments to the information received from interested persons, but may request additional information following review.  Note: If the interested person is a foreign concern or if a U.S interested person has a team member or partner who is a foreign entity, adherence to all the International Traffic and Arms regulations (ITAR) is required.  Responses to this notice shall be sent via e-mail to Samantha Goodyear (samantha.l.goodyear.civ@us.navy.mil) and Zachary Novick (zachary.m.novick.civ@us.navy.mil).  Responses transmitted by any other means (e.g., by telephone, telefax, mail, etc.), other than those transmitted by e-mail to Samantha Goodyear and Zachary Novick will not be considered.

,Naval Air Systems Command,2022-04-07 17:11:00.281000+00:00,2022-04-07,2022-04-22 21:00:00+00:00,2022-04-22,America/New_York,Presolicitation,,488190,Other Support Activities for Air Transportation,J028,Maintenance, Repair and Rebuilding of Equipment: Engines, Turbines, and Components",,Samantha Goodyear,samantha.l.goodyear.civ@us.navy.mil,,,,Zachary Novick,zachary.m.novick.civ@us.navy.mil,,,,,,,,,,9f99136c04774798ace0555cdfc4da89,,,,,,,,,,1700,N00019,NAVAL AIR SYSTEMS COMMAND,ca0259f34396404aa0a2e1be0dd19603,samantha.goodyear@navy.mil,samantha.goodyear@navy.mil,2022-05-08 03:55:58.815000+00:00,2022-04-07 17:07:13.652000+00:00,https://www.highergov.com/contract-opportunity/N00019-22-RFPREQ-APM290-0060PN-Presolicitation-19603,https://sam.gov/opp/ca0259f34396404aa0a2e1be0dd19603/view
df6e6ba503584cedbf42e7a7f798f953,N00019-24-RFPREQ-APM207-0050,C-40A New or Used CFM 56-7B24 Engines,"INTRODUCTION

The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) Tactical Airlift Program Office (PMA-207), Patuxent River, MD is conducting market research to identify potential business sources with the resources, capabilities, and experience to successfully replace multiple CFM56-7B24 Single Angular Combustion (SAC) and Tech Insertion (TI) engines with new or used SAC, TI, or enhanced engines. NAVAIR intends to use the information provided in response to this Sources Sought Synopsis (SSS)/ Rough Order of Magnitude (ROM) Request to aid in refining its acquisition strategy, budget assumptions, and Statement of Work (SOW) for this effort and to determine if any Small Business Set-Aside opportunities exist. All Small Business Set-Aside categories will be considered.
BACKGROUND

The C-40A aircraft is a Boeing 737-700C commercial-derivative cargo/transport/Extended Range Twin Engine Operations (ETOPS) aircraft that is Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) 14 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 25 certified and operated by the United States Navy (USN) and soon to be operated by the United States Marine Corps (USMC). The aircraft are equipped with CFM56-7B24 engines and have been modified with Government unique items with supplement type certifications.
ROUGH ORDER OF MAGNITUDE

Respondents shall submit a unit price estimate in Calendar Year 2022 dollars for the procurement of new or used CFM56-7B24 SAC, CFM56-7BE24 TI, or CFM56-7BE24 enhanced engines to include a Quick Engine Change (QEC) kit for estimated delivery in Fiscal Year 2025 (FY25). The ROM should address specific cost (core) considerations possibilities, specifically whether a core trade-in will be considered. The price estimate shall not include shipping costs.
The following requirements will be considered when making a future purchase decision and shall be addressed in the ROM:

column2: 24,000 LB thrust engines are required
Used engines should have sufficient time (Build Specification) to support 10,000 cycles of operation prior to next engine scheduled shop visit, including Life Limited Components/Parts
ETOPS compliant parts/components are required
Limited Parts Manufacturer Approval (PMA) aftermarket parts are permitted
Rotating PMA parts are not permitted on used engines
Historical engine log records maintained under the full scrutiny of US Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) is critical for the purchase of any used engine
Test Cell review will be required for used engines
Completion of CFM Category 4 Service Bulletins and those of higher importance are instrumental for the Government engine purchase
The Government accepts CFM56-7B24 SAC, CFM56-724/3 TI, or CFM56-7BE24 enhanced engines. The Government realizes new engine purchase options are limited

column1: This notice is NOT a Request for Proposal, is not to be construed as a commitment to procure any items/services, and does not imply or promise that the Government intends to award a contract vehicle as result of this announcement or in response to any capability statements received. In accordance with FAR 15.201(e), responses to this notice are not offers and cannot be accepted by the Government to form a binding contract.

Respondents are responsible for all expenses associated with its response and the Government will not provide any form of compensation for or reimburse any costs incurred in its preparation. Submissions are not to exceed five 8.5 x 11 pages with one inch margins printed in Times New Roman or Courier New 12-pt font. One electronic soft copy shall be delivered to the Government POC in Microsoft Word or PDF format no later than 4:30PM EST on 10 April 2022.

All submissions should include ROM Reference Number, company, address, CAGE code, and DUNS number, a point of contact with a phone number and email address, and business size status for the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code(s) relevant to your company’s response (i.e., large business, small business, certified 8(a) concern, veteran-owned, HUBZone, woman-owned, etc.). Responses to this ROM may NOT be submitted via facsimile. Acknowledgement of receipt will be provided if request for return receipt is included with the response, but submissions will not be returned.

All information submitted will be adequately safeguarded from unauthorized disclosure in accordance with FAR Part 15.207. However, classified data should not be provided. If respondent believes that a complete response would require inclusion of proprietary information, please notify the Government POC immediately. Summary papers failing to comply with the above instructions or containing impertinent information may not be reviewed. Note: If the interested party is a foreign concern or if a US interested party has a team member or partner who is a foreign entity, adherence to all International Traffic and Arms Regulations (ITAR) is required.
DISCLAIMER

THIS SOURCES SOUGHT IS FOR INFORMATIONAL AND PLANNING PURPOSES ONLY. THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) OR A PROMISE TO ISSUE A RFP IN THE FUTURE. IT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A COMMITMENT BY THE GOVERNMENT. THE UNITED STATES NAVY (USN), IS NOT CURRENTLY SEEKING PROPOSALS AND WILL NOT ACCEPT UNSOLICITED PROPOSALS. RESPONSES IN ANY FORM ARE NOT OFFERS AND THE GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO AWARD A CONTRACT AS A RESULT OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT. NO FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO PAY FOR PREPARATION OF RESPONSES TO THIS ANNOUNCEMENT. ANY INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY RESPONDENTS TO THIS TECHNICAL DESCRIPTION IS STRICTLY VOLUNTARY AND ANY ASSOCIATED COSTS INCURRED ARE THE RESPONDENT’S SOLE RESPONSIBILITY.
Questions regarding this announcement shall be submitted to the Government point of contact identified herein.
Contracting Office Address:
21936 Bundy Road, Building 442
Patuxent River, Maryland 20670
United States

10. Describe your company's Over and Above (O&A) approach/process during various Repair, Restoration, and Overhaul scenarios.
11. The P-8A engines will not be utilizing parts from a commercial spare parts pool.  Describe how your company will manage P-8A specific engine parts.
12. Describe your company's processes for segregating Government hardware/material to ensure it does not mix with other customer assets.
13. Describe your company’s processes for preventing counterfeit parts from being installed into Navy engines.
14. Describe your company’s process for managing life limited parts/long-lead life limited parts.
15. Does your company maintain insurance that covers military engines?
16. Describe your standard warranty(ies) (e.g., what is warranted and for how long).
17. Confirm your company’s ability to provide examples of an FAA approved repair substantiation data package and used part/component maintenance history/service records.
18. Describe your company’s ability to provide engine Field Assessment and Repair coverage (e.g., field assessment and repair at a field activity location or at a deployed location).
19. Describe your company’s maximum engine throughput per year and ability to meet potential surge requirements beyond the maximum throughput.
20. For reference:

a.   This effort requires vendors to have licenses in place with The Boeing Company for Boeing specific technical data prior to contract award.  Boeing technical data may be required to maintain/repair the EBU or to incorporate Boeing service bulletins related to the EBU.
b.   This effort requires vendors to enter Engine Transaction Reports (ETR) into the Navy’s DECKPLATE database system.
21. If you are a small business, provide an explanation of your company’s ability to perform at least 50% of the tasking described in this SOW for the base period as well as the option periods.
22. Provide a statement including current small/large business status and company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office locations, CAGE code, DUNS number, etc.

23. Respondents to this notice must also indicate whether they are a large business or qualify as a Small, Small Disadvantaged, Small Disadvantaged Veteran Owned Small Business, Women-Owned, 8(a), Hub Zone or Service Disabled Veteran-Owned Small Business Concern.
24. Please add other information your company believes is relevant to aid the Government in refining its acquisition strategy.

Any capability statements marked in a manner that will not permit such review may be returned without being assessed or considered.  All submissions must include a statement which clearly allows for the information to be disclosed with covered Government support contractors. ,Naval Air Systems Command,2022-03-15 14:50:53.617000+00:00,2022-03-15,2022-03-30 21:00:00+00:00,2022-03-30,America/New_York,Sources Sought,,488190,Other Support Activities for Air Transportation,J028,Maintenance, Repair and Rebuilding of Equipment: Engines, Turbines, and Components",,Samantha Goodyear,samantha.l.goodyear.civ@us.navy.mil,,,,Zachary Novick,zachary.m.novick.civ@us.navy.mil,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,,1700,N00019,NAVAL AIR SYSTEMS COMMAND,4e6ebd74ed4e415faafb1d8ccc042825,samantha.goodyear@navy.mil,samantha.goodyear@navy.mil,2022-04-15 03:55:57.677000+00:00,2022-03-15 14:46:11.127000+00:00,https://www.highergov.com/contract-opportunity/N00019-22-RFPREQ-APM290-0060SS-Sources_Sought-42825,https://sam.gov/opp/9f99136c04774798ace0555cdfc4da89/view
5f85b97ef1c14fdfbd3fbde8eb2541bb,N00019-22-RFPREQ-APM207-0369,C-40A CFM56-7B24 Engine Overhaul ROM,"INTRODUCTION

The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) Tactical Airlift Program Office (PMA-207), Patuxent River, MD is conducting market research to identify potential business sources with the resources, capabilities, and experience to successfully perform the multiple C-40A CFM56-7B24 engine overhauls beginning as early as 2025 and occurring over a three to five year period. NAVAIR intends to use the information provided in response to this Sources Sought Synopsis (SSS)/Request for Information (RFI) to aid in refining its acquisition strategy, budget assumptions, and Statement of Work (SOW) for this effort and to determine if any Small Business Set-Aside opportunities exist. All Small Business Set-Aside categories will be considered.
BACKGROUND

The C-40A aircraft is a Boeing 737-700C commercial-derivative cargo/transport/Extended Range Twin Engine Operations (ETOPS) aircraft that is Federal Aviation Administration (FAA) 14 Code of Federal Regulations (CFR) Part 25 certified and operated by the United States Navy (USN) and soon to be operated by the United States Marine Corps (USMC). The aircraft are equipped with CFM56-7B24 engines and have been modified with Government unique items with supplement type certifications.
ROUGH ORDER OF MAGNITUDE

Respondents shall submit a unit price estimate in Calendar Year 2022 dollars for the overhaul of CFM56-7B24 Singular Angular Combustion (SAC) engines or Tech Insertion (TI) engines using the CFM Work Scope Planning Guide (WSPG), dated March 2021 (see page 16 for overhaul and build specification to 10,000 and 20,000 cycle repair level options). At this time, the Government anticipates 10 – 20 engine overhauls will be required over a three to five year period. The initial 10 engines will be SAC engines. Approximately halfway into that period, some TI engines will be overhauled as well. The Contractor shall ensure the inspection and overhaul facilities hold and maintain an appropriate FAA Part 145 Air Agency Certificates for the CFM56-7B24 engine. Overhauls will be performed at approximately 14,500 flight cycles. Overhaul turn-around-time shall be 120 days between shipping to and shipping from the vendor.
The ROM shall not include the price of shipping and shall contain two alternate estimates:

column2: Core Performance Restoration and replacement of the Core and LPT LLP hardware and the incorporation of all CFM Category 1-4 Service actions, which should yield 10,000 cycles of on-wing time before the next forced shop visit; and

Core Performance Restoration and replacement of all LLP hardware (Fan, Core, LPT) and the incorporation of all CFM Category 1-4 Service actions, which should yield 20,000 cycles of on-wing time before the next forced shop visit.

column1: The price estimates shall include:

column2: The labor required to perform the initial inspection, provide inventory control, and complete the initial teardown report;
All labor, parts, and material required to complete the overhaul; and
The repair/overhaul or replacement and re-installation of components and assemblies.

column1: Provisions for Over and Above (O&A) will be incorporated into a resultant contract for discrepancies found during the engine inspection, deemed to be out-of-scope.

The scope will not include support equipment overhaul. The Government is considering the incorporation of trailer inspection and repair, but cannot confirm at this time that the work will be included in the Statement of Work (SOW), therefore, it should not be included in the ROM
CABILITY STATEMENT

Respondents shall submit a capabilities statement of no more than ten (10) one-sided, 8.5x11 inch pages in length with font no smaller than 10 point, demonstrating ability to perform the services described herein.
Capability statements shall address the following:

column2: Type of work performed in the past in support of the same or similar requirement;
Experience managing an effort of this nature;
Experience with or ability to manage a team of subcontractors;
Specific technical skills which ensure capability to perform the effort;

Small/large business status under the North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) Code of 336412 and company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office locations, Data Universal Numbering System (DUNs) number, etc.:

Qualification as a Small Business (SB), Small Disadvantaged Business (SDB), Women-Owned Small Business (WOSB), HUBZone Small Business (HUBZone), Veteran-Owned Small Business (VOSB), or Service-Disabled Veteran Owned Small Business (SDVOSB) Concern; and

Explanation of ability to perform at least 50% of the tasking described in terms of the cost of contract performance incurred for personnel shall be expended for employees of the concern in accordance with FAR 52.219-14.

column1: ELIGIBILITY

The appropriate Product Service Code (PSC) is J028. The NAICS Code is 336412 with a Small Business Size of 1,500 employees. All vendors must be registered in Systems for award Management (SAM Database) with its DUNs number and Commercial and Government Entity (CAGE) Code in order to conduct business with the Department of Defense.
SUBMISSION

Interested businesses' responses to this SSS/RFI, including any capabilities statement, shall be electronically submitted in Microsoft Word or Portable Document Format (PDF) to the Contract Specialist at karin.p.jensvold.civ@us.navy.mil no later than 1600 Eastern Standard Time on 17 January 2022. All responses shall include the Company name, address, and business size and shall identify points of contact by name, telephone number, and email address. All attached documents shall reference this SSS/RFI number.
NOTE

Should the Government release a solicitation for the effort described herein, it will be synopsized on this site as early as FY24. It is the responsibility of potential offerors to monitor this site for additional information pertaining to this requirement. Be advised that periodic visitation to the website is essential for obtaining updated documentation and the latest information regarding this procurement. All data received in response to this SSS/RFI that are marked or designated as corporate or proprietary will be fully protected from release outside the Government.
DISCLAIMER

THIS SOURCES SOUGHT IS FOR INFORMATIONAL AND PLANNING PURPOSES ONLY. THIS IS NOT A REQUEST FOR PROPOSAL (RFP) OR A PROMISE TO ISSUE A RFP IN THE FUTURE. IT DOES NOT CONSTITUTE A SOLICITATION AND SHALL NOT BE CONSTRUED AS A COMMITMENT BY THE GOVERNMENT. THE UNITED STATES NAVY (USN), IS NOT CURRENTLY SEEKING PROPOSALS AND WILL NOT ACCEPT UNSOLICITED PROPOSALS. RESPONSES IN ANY FORM ARE NOT OFFERS AND THE GOVERNMENT IS UNDER NO OBLIGATION TO AWARD A CONTRACT AS A RESULT OF THIS ANNOUNCEMENT. NO FUNDS ARE AVAILABLE TO PAY FOR PREPARATION OF RESPONSES TO THIS ANNOUNCEMENT. ANY INFORMATION SUBMITTED BY RESPONDENTS TO THIS TECHNICAL DESCRIPTION IS STRICTLY VOLUNTARY AND ANY ASSOCIATED COSTS INCURRED ARE THE RESPONDENT’S SOLE RESPONSIBILITY.

b6cb017d2cd94648a264e39a31f0679b,FA8122-21-R-0008,Remanufacture of F108 LPT Stage I Nozzle Segments,"The 421 SCMS has an ongoing need for the F108 CFM56-2 Engine support. This requirement is supported 100% via contractor as the OCALC has no organic support capability at this time. This requirement is to provide the remanufacture of the F108 Low Pressure Turbine (LPT) Stage I Nozzle Segments. The LPT Stage I Nozzle Segments direct core engine exhaust gas onto the Stage I LPT blades for the F108 Engine.

The anticipated contract will be a firm-fixed price (FFP), commercial, requirements-type contract comprised of One Base Year with Four One-Year Option Periods and a projected period of performance from February 2022 to February 2027.
See Attached Synopsis.  Please refer to Appendix I for CLIN and NSN breakdown.

9659b7e88e9e4dfca29d0e07d1fd8d8e,N68335-21-R-0298,EcoPower Engine Wash System,"The Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division Lakehurst, NJ intends to solicit, negotiate, and award a Firm Fixed Price contract, on a sole source basis to EcoServices, LLC, Wethersfield, CT for the procurement of an EcoPower Engine Wash System, Part Number PWP3600, and its accessories to meet the requirement for washing the CFM56-7B engines on the P-8A Poseidon Aircraft for the United States Navy.

The Government intends to procure the above items under the statutory authority of Title 10, U.S.C. Section 2304(c)(1), as implemented by Federal Acquisition Regulation (FAR) 6.302-1, Only one responsible source and no other supplies or services will satisfy agency requirements. EcoServices, LLC owns all proprietary rights to the engineering data and detailed product drawings. EcoServices, LLC is the only manufacturer with the unique technical expertise to supply these items and has no authorized distributors. The Government does not own the technical data rights for the existing configuration.

No solicitation will be available for this procurement.

af9b7ad0bb544ca5972990ea22b2479e,N00019-21-RFPREQ-APM290-1126PS2,P-8A CFM56-7B27 AE SermeTel Coated High Pressure Compressor (HPC) Assemblies and Cases,"The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR), Patuxent River, MD intends to award a commercial item contract to CFM International (CFM), located in Ohio, on an other than full and open competition basis, for the procurement of approximately two (2) new production CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated High Pressure Compressor (HPC) Forward Stator Assemblies (P/N 9324M66G06), approximately one (1) new production CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator High Pressure Compressor (HPC) Case (P/N: 1559M30G15), and HPC assembly hardware parts to support U.S. Navy (USN) requirements. Planned award date is September 2021 and all deliveries to be completed within 1 year of award.

The effort shall be procured pursuant to 10 U.S.C. 2304 (c)(1) and FAR 6.302-1, “Only One Responsible Source and No Other Type of Supplies or Services will Satisfy Agency Requirements.”  CFM is the only source with the requisite knowledge, experience, technical expertise, and technical data necessary to furnish the contemplated supplies and services in a timely manner.
BACKGROUND:

CFM is the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) of the CFM56-7B27AE engine, which is the only certified engine for the P-8A.  As the original designer, developer, and manufacturer of the CFM56-7B27 engine, CFM is the only company that possesses the complete set of technical data and drawings to manufacture CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated HPC Forward Stator Assemblies, CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases, and HPC assembly hardware parts.  Since NAVAIR does not have access to the relevant source data, it would be unable to independently verify that SermeTel Coated HPC Forward Stator Assemblies, SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases, and HPC assembly hardware parts from another source meet specifications.
SUBMISSION DETAILS:

Interested persons may submit a Capability Statement identifying their interest and capability to respond to the requirement or submit proposals.  Only Capability Statements received on or before the Response Date of this Notice will be considered by the Government.  A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract action based upon responses to this Notice is solely within the discretion of the Government.  Capability Statements received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement.  Capability Statements submitted should be pertinent and specific in the technical/management/business area under consideration, on each of the following qualifications.

(1) Execution:  A description of the approach for obtaining and delivering the new production CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated HPC Forward Stator Assemblies, CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases, and HPC assembly hardware parts.  Due to the fact that CFM is the OEM for the CFM56-7B27AE engines, each SermeTel Coated HPC Forward Stator Assembly, SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Case, and HPC assembly hardware part must be from a CFM approved source.
(2) Any other specific and pertinent information as it pertains to this particular area of procurement that would enhance our consideration and evaluation of the Capability Statement.

Interested parties are advised against submitting a Capability Statement/Proposal that merely mimics information in this Notice, provides brochure-like information, or provides general information.  Responses to this Notice are not to exceed 20 pages in length on 8.5 x 11 inch paper with one inch margins and font no smaller than 10 point Times New Roman.  The Government requests that respondents deliver responses electronically via e-mail in Microsoft Word or PDF format with proper data markings for unclassified and proprietary information no later than the Response Date of this Notice.  Classified material SHALL NOT be submitted.  All submissions should include this Presolicitation Notice Reference Number, company name, company address, CAGE code, DUNS number, and a point-of-contact who is able to discuss the Capability Statement submitted.  Point-of-contact information should include name, position, phone number, and email address.  Acknowledgement of receipt will be provided.  All information submitted will be adequately safeguarded from unauthorized disclosure in accordance with FAR 15.207.  All submissions must be clearly marked with the following caption:  For Official Use Only, Releasable to Government Agencies for Evaluation Purposes Only.  Responses that fail to comply with the above instructions or present ideas not pertinent to subject, may not be reviewed.  All information received in response to this Notice that is marked proprietary will be handled accordingly.  Information submitted in response to this Notice is submitted at no cost to the Government and will not be returned.  The Government is under no obligation to provide responses or comments to information received from interested persons, but may request additional information following review.  Note:  If the interested person is a foreign concern or if a U.S. interested person has a team member or partner who is a foreign entity, adherence to all International Traffic and Arms Regulations (ITAR) is required.

Responses to this Notice shall be sent via e-mail to Scott Segesdy at scott.segesdy@navy.mil and Victor Onwuka at victor.onwuka@navy.mil. Responses transmitted by any other means (e.g., by telephone, telefax, mail, etc.), other than those transmitted by e-mail to Scott Segesdy, Victor Onwuka and Cassandra Conley, will not be considered.

df99cccd2a9945eba12be619383c8dc7,N00019-21-RFPREQ-PMA-290-0241PS,P-8A Poseidon CFM56-7B27AE Turbine Rear Frame Drain Plug Deflectors,"The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) intends to execute a commercial item procurement of approximately 185 new production CFM56-7B27AE Turbine Rear Frame Drain Plug Deflectors (P/N: 340-201-003-0) to support US Navy (USN) requirements from CFM International (CFM). Planned award is March 2021 with all deliveries estimated to be completed within 1 year after award.
DISCLAIMER:

This Sources Sought Notice is issued in accordance with DFARS 206.302-1(d) and PGI 206.302-1.  This is not a Request for Proposals.  Responses in any form are not offers and the Government is under no obligation to award a contract as a result of this Notice. The Government does not intend to award a contract on the basis of this Notice or otherwise pay any person’s costs incurred responding to this Notice.
Background:

The CFM56-7B27AE is the only engine certified for the P-8A. The CFM56-7B27AE Turbine Rear Frame Drain Plug Deflectors are required to prevent overheating on the thrust reverser fire seal by diverting the hot air flow exiting from the drain plug further from the thrust reverser fire seal. Currently, the Government neither possess nor has sufficient rights in the necessary data developed by the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) for the CFM56-7B27AE engines to certify any parts that are not new production CFM56-7B27AE Turbine Rear Frame Drain Plug Deflectors. The OEM is CFM International (CFM)

8a8ecae8127b43ddbc644475fd57930d,N00019-20-NORFP-PMA-290-1085,REPAIRS OF P-8A ENGINE INDUCTED AT CONTRACTOR FACILITY,"On 16 September 2020 the Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) awarded order modification N0001920F0399P00001 under P-8A Engine Depot Maintenance and Repair Indefinite Delivery Indefinite Quantity (IDIQ) Multiple Award Contract (MAC) N0001918D0113 to The Boeing Company (Boeing), Seattle, WA, under an exception to the fair opportunity process.  In accordance with FAR 16.505(b)(2)(i)(A), the modification was issued on a sole-source basis because the Navy’s need for the services is so urgent that providing a fair opportunity would result in unacceptable delays.  The Justification for an Exception to Fair Opportunity is attached to this Notice.  The two IDIQ MAC contractors are Standard Aero [Contract N0001918D0110] and Boeing [Contract N0001918D0113].  Pursuant to and in accordance with each contract, NAVAIR conducted a competition between the two IDIQ contractors for Option Period 2 (FY2020 ordering period).  As to Period 2 engine inductions, Boeing was selected as the Primary Awardee and Standard Aero was selected as the Secondary Awardee.  The order currently procures depot level maintenance and repair of P-8A Poseidon aircraft CFM56-7B27 engines. To maintain Fleet readiness, the instant modification will procure the same services for four additional CFM56-7B27 engines.  The total dollar value of the awarded modification is $10,000,000 with performance to be completed on or before 31 May 2021.  This notice is provided for information only.

5e76ef7d5e0341a98e72ef9aa4597117,N68335-20-RFI-0363,Eco Power Engine Wash System,"RFI Number:  N68335-20-RFI-0363
Classification Code: 4920; Aircraft Maintenance and Repair Shop Specialized Equipment
NAICS Code(s):  333999 - All Other Miscellaneous General Purpose Machinery Manufacturing

THIS IS A REQUEST FOR INFORMATION (RFI) ONLY. THERE IS NO SOLICITATION PACKAGE AVAILABLE. The following information is provided to assist the Naval Air Warfare Center Aircraft Division (NAVAIR) Lakehurst, NJ in conducting market research of industry to identify if there are alternate sources to meet the needs of the United States Navy (USN) for the procurement of an EcoPower Engine Wash System and its accessories to meet the requirement for washing the CFM56-7B engines on the P-8A Poseidon Aircraft for the USN.

At this time, pending market research results, NAVAIR Lakehurst, NJ intends to negotiate on a non-competitive basis with EcoServices, LLC, Wethersfield, CT for the required EcoPower Engine Wash System.

EcoServices, LLC designed the EcoPower Engine Wash System at their own expense and it has been demonstrated and evaluated to meet specifications for maintenance of the P-8A CFM56-7B engines. The EcoPower Engine Wash System is also being evaluated by the Navy Environmental Sustainability Development to Integration group for use on other USN platforms and may become a common piece of engine wash support equipment.

EcoServices, LLC owns all proprietary rights to the engineering data and detailed product drawings. EcoServices, LLC is the only manufacturer with the unique technical expertise to supply these items and has no authorized distributors. The Government does not own the technical data rights for the existing configuration.
The Engine Wash System for the P-8A shall:
1. Be compatible with the CFM56-7B engine installed on the 737-derivative P-8A aircraft.

2. Filter/treat potable water and produce water with the following properties: pH between 6.0 and 8.0, Total Dissolved Solids (TDS) concentration less than 100 ppm, and Sodium + Potassium concentration less than 25 ppm.
3. Have the ability to pump, filter, and reuse the engine wash effluent that is captured in a separate engine effluent containment system.
4. Include a pressure-washing wand capable of spot cleaning accessible engine and aircraft components.
5. Atomize the water injected into the engine to ensure maximum water penetration throughout the compressor.
6. Be able to heat the water to 70 C.
7. Supply regulated clean dry air or nitrogen between 20 and 100 psi for a minimum of 10 seconds.
8. Be able to be maneuvered manually by two or fewer persons. The system shall also be able to be towed by a vehicle with a pintle hook.
9. Contain a parking brake.
10. Operate on external electrical power or using an onboard generator compatible with JP-8 fuel.
11. Have a display or sight glass to indicate the remaining water level and fuel level (if applicable).
12. Be able to be lifted with a forklift and have dedicated tie down points for shipping.
13. Be capable of holding a minimum of 60 gallons of water.
14. Allow for the addition of Isopropyl Alcohol or Ethylene Glycol to the water holding tank for cold weather operations.
15. Have an emergency shutdown switch.
16. Have a safeguard to protect against heating an empty water tank.

8c74b05c63d94f9c86544a8e303cf0f2,N00019-20-RFPREQ-PMA-290-0828PS,SermeTel Coated Front Stator High Pressure Compressor (HPC) Cases,"The Naval Air Systems Command (NAVAIR) intends to award a commercial item contract action to CFM International (CFM), located in Ohio, on an other than full and open basis, procuring approximately seven (7) new production CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator High Pressure Compressor (HPC) Cases (P/N: 1559M30G15) to support US Navy (USN) and Royal Australian Air Force (RAAF) requirements.  Planned award is September 2020 with all deliveries completed not later than September 2021.

The effort will be procured pursuant to 10 U.S.C. 2304 (c)(1) and FAR 6.302-1, “Only One Responsible Source and No Other Type of Supplies or Services will Satisfy Agency Requirements.”  CFM is the Original Equipment Manufacturer (OEM) of the CFM56-7B27AE engine, which is the only certified engine for the P-8A.  As the original designer, developer, and manufacturer of the CFM56-7B27 engine, CFM is the only company that possesses the complete set of technical data and drawings to manufacture CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases.  NAVAIR does not have access to the relevant source data to independently verify that CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases from another source meet specifications.  Therefore, CFM is the only source capable of timely fulfilling the requirements.
BACKGROUND:

The CFM56-7B27AE is the only engine certified for the P-8A and CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated High Pressure Compressor Stator Cases are required to maintain configuration consistency with the engines and aircraft that have been delivered.  Currently, the Government neither possesses nor has sufficient rights in the necessary data developed by CFM for the CFM56-7B27AE engines to certify any cases that are not new production CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases.
SUBMISSION DETAILS:

Interested persons may submit a Capability Statement identifying their interest and capability to respond to the requirement or submit proposals.  Only Capability Statements received on or before the Response Date indicated in this Notice will be considered by the Government.  A determination by the Government not to compete this proposed contract action based upon responses to this Notice is solely within the discretion of the Government.  Capability Statements received will normally be considered solely for the purpose of determining whether to conduct a competitive procurement.  Capability Statements submitted should be pertinent and specific in the technical/management/business area under consideration, on each of the following qualifications.

(1) Small/Large Business Status:  A company profile to include number of employees, annual revenue history, office location(s), DUNS Number, CAGE Code, and a statement regarding current small/large business status.

(2) Execution:  A description of the approach for obtaining and delivering new CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Cases.  Due to the fact that CFM is the OEM for the CFM56-7B27AE engines, each CFM56-7B27AE SermeTel Coated Front Stator HPC Case must be from a CFM approved source.
(3) Any other specific and pertinent information as it pertains to this particular area of procurement that would enhance our consideration and evaluation of the Capability Statement.

Interested parties are advised against submitting a Capability Statement/Proposal that merely mimics information in this Notice, provides brochure-like information, or provides general information.  Responses to this Notice are not to exceed 20 pages in length on 8.5 x 11 inch paper with one inch margins and font no smaller than 10 point Times New Roman.  The Government requests that respondents deliver responses electronically via e-mail in Microsoft Word or PDF format.  Classified material SHALL NOT be submitted.  All submissions shall include this Notice Reference Number, company name, company address, CAGE code, DUNS number, and a point-of-contact who is able to discuss the Capability Statement submitted.  Point-of-contact information shall include name, position, phone number, and email address.  Acknowledgement of receipt will be provided.  All information submitted will be adequately safeguarded from unauthorized disclosure in accordance with FAR 15.207.  All submissions must be clearly marked with the following caption:  For Official Use Only, Releasable to Government Agencies for Evaluation Purposes Only.  In order to complete its review, NAVAIR must be able to share a respondent’s information within the Government and with covered Government support contractors as defined in DFARS clause 252.227-7013 Rights in Technical Data—Noncommercial Items (FEB 2014).  Any responses marked in a manner that will not permit such review may be returned without being assessed or considered.  All submissions must include a statement which clearly allows for the information to be disclosed within the Government and with covered Government support contractors as defined in DFARS clause 252.227-7013 Rights in Technical Data-Noncommercial Items (FEB 2014).  Responses that fail to comply with the above instructions or present ideas not pertinent to subject, may not be reviewed.  Information submitted in response to this Notice is submitted at no cost to the Government and will not be returned.  The Government is under no obligation to provide responses or comments to information received from interested persons, but may request additional information following review.  Note:  If the interested person is a foreign concern or if a U.S. interested person has a team member or partner who is a foreign entity, adherence to all International Traffic and Arms Regulations (ITAR) is required.

Responses to this Notice shall be sent via e-mail to Scott Segesdy at scott.segesdy@navy.mil and Cassandra Conley at cassandra.conley@navy.mil. Responses transmitted by any other means (e.g., by telephone, telefax, mail, etc.), other than those transmitted by e-mail to Scott Segesdy and Cassandra Conley, will not be considered.
